meanings.definition: To have teeth or toothlike projections.
meanings.sent1: The puppy teethes on his favorite chew toy.
meanings.sent2: She teethes on the crunchy carrot.
meanings.sent3: The baby teethes on anything within reach, including his own fingers.
meanings.sent4: The machine teethes through the tough material effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The squirrel teethes on nuts to crack them open.

meanings.definition: To cut, tear, or gnaw with or as if with the teeth.
meanings.sent1: The scissors teethes through the paper easily.
meanings.sent2: He teethes on the tough steak to chew it properly.
meanings.sent3: The beaver teethes on wood to build its dam.
meanings.sent4: The wind teethes at the edges of the old house.
meanings.sent5: The caterpillar teethes through the leaf to eat.

meanings.sent1: The baby teethes slowly but steadily.
meanings.sent2: The child teethes as part of growing up.
meanings.sent3: The puppy teethes and explores the world with its new teeth.
meanings.sent4: The plant teethes through the soil to establish its roots.
meanings.sent5: The shark teethes constantly to replace lost teeth.
